module.description: UNIVERSAL TEST AND OPERATIONS INTERFACE FOR ASYNCHRONOUS TRANSFER MODE

bitfield.description: Endian Mode for data transferred via UTOPIA interface.

bitenum.description: Data is assembled to conform to Little-endian format
Data is assembled to conform to Big-endian format

bitfield.description: Slave ID: Applicable in Slave and MPHY mode.Slave END:Applicable in Master and MPHY mode.

bitenum.description: Transmits standard ATM cell size of 53B
Applicable for slave mode only. Transmits 11 extra header bytes

bitfield.description: UTOPIA Transmit in master or slave mode selection

bitenum.description: UTOPIA port Transmitter Disabled and in reset state.
loop back mode disabled and normal UTOPIA operation
loop back mode enabled.Master/Slave selection via U(R/X)MSTR

bitfield.description: UTOPIA Receive/Transmit Multi-PHY Mode. MPHY mode is by default.

bitenum.description: 8-bit operation on both transmit and receive UTOPIA interface
16-bit operation on both transmit and receive UTOPIA interface

bitfield.description: UTOPIA polling mode .Valid only when UMSTR=1

bitenum.description: Receives standard ATM cell size of 53B
Applicable for slave mode only. Receives 11 extra header bytes

bitfield.description: UTOPIA receive in master or slave mode selection

bitenum.description: Transmit and Receive interface are in slave mode :default state
Transmit and Receive interface are in master mode
UTOPIA port receiver is disabled and in reset state

bitfield.description: Receive Queue Interrupt Pending 7 is captured in UIPR
Receive Queue Interrupt Pending 6 is captured in UIPR
Receive Queue Interrupt Pending 5 is captured in UIPR
Receive Queue Interrupt Pending 4 is captured in UIPR
Receive Queue Interrupt Pending 3 is captured in UIPR
Receive Queue Interrupt Pending 2 is captured in UIPR
Receive Queue Interrupt Pending 1 is captured in UIPR
Receive Queue Interrupt Pending 0 is captured in UIPR
Transmit Queue Interrupt Pending 7 is captured in UIPR
Transmit Queue Interrupt Pending 6 is captured in UIPR
Transmit Queue Interrupt Pending 5 is captured in UIPR
Transmit Queue Interrupt Pending 4 is captured in UIPR
Transmit Queue Interrupt Pending 3 is captured in UIPR
Transmit Queue Interrupt Pending 2 is captured in UIPR
Transmit Queue Interrupt Pending 1 is captured in UIPR
Transmit Queue Interrupt Pending 0 is captured in UIPR
Transmit Clock Present Interrupt Pending.XCPP is valid regardless if UXEN is set or not.

bitenum.description: UXCLK present. If the corresponding bit in the EIER is set,an interrupt UINT is sent to the CPU.

bitfield.description: Transmit Clock Failed Interrupt Pending.Activated only when UXEN=1.

bitenum.description: UXCLK failed. If the corresponding bit in the EIER is set,an interrupt UINT is sent to the CPU.

bitfield.description: Transmit Queue Stall Interrupt Pending.Stalled untill the queue is drained and space is available.

bitenum.description: Transmit Queue Stalled.XQSP is cleared once the queue has space available and writes can continue.

bitfield.description: Receive Clock Present Interrupt Pending.RCPP is valid regardless if UREN is set or not.

bitenum.description: URCLK present. If the corresponding bit in the EIER is set,an interrupt UINT is sent to the CPU.

bitfield.description: Receive Clock Failed Interrupt Pending.Activated only when UTOPIA Receive Interface(UREN=1)

bitenum.description: URCLK failed.If corresponding bit in EIER is set,an interrupt UINT is sent to the CPU.
Receive Queue Stalled.RQSP is cleared as soon as Valid data is available and the read is performed.

bitfield.description: Indicates Least Significant Byte of the 16-bit field of interest.
Indicates the least significant bit within the 16-bit field of interest that is used for routing decisions.

register.description: Transmit Cell Available for PHY Register(XCAPR)
Register to identify the peripheral for revision number,class,and type.

bitfield.description: The Type of peripheral specifies the actual peripheral within a peripheral Class. For UTOPIA, the Class in the UIPDR[Class] defines UTOPIA Level 2 interface.
The Class indicates if the peripheral is a Host interface, DMA controller, or a Network Interface, etc. UTOPIA belongs to the Class - Network Interface that always carries a value '3'.

register.description: UTOPIA Power Management and Emulation Register

bitfield.description: This Bit has no effect when FREE=1.

bitenum.description: In Slave mode all on-going operations should be complete.In master Mode Mode: Current data transfer on the pins should complete and pending read/write requests to/from CPU/DMA should complete before emulation halt.

bitfield.description: This Bit in conjunction with SOFT bit determines Emulation operation

bitenum.description: SOFT bit controls Emulation During Emulation Halt
Emulation has no effect on UTOPIA port Operation.Peripheral operates Normally.

bitfield.description: UXSoc and UXAddr[4:0] are used as GPIO.
UXEnb and UXClav are used as GPIO
UXDATA[15:0] are used for GPIO (8-bits for utopia-8 and 16-bits for utopia-16)
Utopia pins URSOC and URAddr[4:0] are controlled as GPIO
UREnb and URClav pins are Controlled as GPIO
URData[15:0] are used for GPIO (8-bits for utopia-8 and 16-bits for utopia-16)

bitenum.description: GPIO interrupt not inverted. Polarity remains same as that at the pin(s).
Relevant GPIO interrupt is inverted. It could be any of the pins.
1, Low-to-high transition on the UXData[0] pin causes interrupt RQIP0 to CPU via UIPR and UIER. It can also generate DMA event XEVT0.
Low-to-high transition on the UXClav pin causes interrupt XQIP1 to CPU via UIPR and UIER. It can also generate DMA event XEVT1
Low-to-high transition on the UXSOC pin causes interrupt XQIP2 to CPU via UIPR and UIER. It can also generate DMA event XEVT2.
1, Low-to-high transition on the URData[0] pin causes interrupt RQIP0 to CPU via UIPR and UIER. It can also generate DMA event REVT0.
Low-to-high transition on the URClav pin causes interrupt RQIP1 to CPU via UIPR and UIER. It can also generate DMA event REVT1.
Low-to-high transition on the URSOC pin causes interrupt RQIP2 to CPU via UIPR and UIER. It can also generate DMA event REVT2.

bitfield.description: corresponding interrupts RQIP[7:3] to CPU via UIPR and UIER. It can also generate DMA event
RADR [4:0] = 1, Low-to-high transition on the Receive Address pins URAddr[4:0] cause
